topic: Deep dive: cgi standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: cgi standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: CGI Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth look at the CGI (Common Gateway Interface) standard library module in Python 3.12+, discussing its features, usage, and examples.
key_points: The CGI module allows Python scripts to respond to web requests made through a web server.
It is primarily used for creating simple web applications or handling form submissions.
Python 3.12+ improvements include faster execution and better compatibility with modern web servers.
The module works by converting incoming HTTP request data into environment variables.

code_examples.code:
import cgi
form = cgi.FieldStorage()
name = form['name'].value

version_notes: In Python 3.12+, the CGI module has been updated to improve performance and compatibility.
It is recommended to use WSGI (Web Server Gateway Interface) for more complex and scalable web applications.
caveats: The CGI module can be slower compared to other methods like WSGI due to its simplicity and per-request initialization.
It does not support HTTP 1.1 features like chunked encoding, cookies, or keep-alive connections.
